sections.title: What is a Lathe?
sections.content: A lathe is a machine tool that rotates a workpiece about an axis of rotation to perform various operations such as cutting, sanding, knurling, drilling, or deformation, with tools that are applied to the workpiece to create an object with symmetry about that axis.

sections.title: Types of Lathes
sections.content: There are many different types of lathes, each with its own strengths and weaknesses. Some of the most common types include engine lathes, turret lathes, and CNC lathes.

sections.title: Safety Precautions
sections.content: When operating a lathe, it is important to take safety precautions to avoid injury. These precautions include wearing proper safety gear, such as safety glasses and gloves, and keeping the work area clean and free of debris.

sections.title: Setting Up the Lathe
sections.content: Before you can start using a lathe, you need to set it up properly. This includes setting the speed, feed, and depth of cut, as well as mounting the workpiece securely.

sections.title: Basic Lathe Operations
sections.content: Once the lathe is set up, you can start performing basic operations, such as turning, facing, and boring.

sections.title: Advanced Lathe Operations
sections.content: Once you have mastered the basics, you can start learning more advanced operations, such as threading, knurling, and drilling.

sections.title: Cleaning and Lubrication
sections.content: It is important to keep your lathe clean and lubricated to ensure that it operates properly and lasts for many years.

sections.title: Troubleshooting
sections.content: If you encounter any problems with your lathe, there are a few things you can do to troubleshoot the issue.

glossary.axis of rotation: The imaginary line around which an object rotates.
glossary.chuck: A device used to hold a workpiece in place on a lathe.
glossary.feed: The rate at which the cutting tool moves across the workpiece.
glossary.lathe bed: The main structural component of a lathe, which supports the headstock, tailstock, and carriage.
glossary.spindle: The rotating shaft that holds the workpiece.
